name: python_psynth
tagline: The official Python library for programmatically generating graphs in Psymphonic Psynth.
body:
## python_psynth
python_psynth is the official python package for generating graphs in Psymphonic Psynth.  It is published under the MIT license, and we encourage you to use it for anything and everything your heart desires.

```
pip install psynth
```

### Quickstart
```
from psynth.psynth import *
from random import randint


# Create a Graph
g = create_graph(
    name='your graph name',
    url='http://psynth.psymphonic.com',
    username='you@company.com',
    key='yourapikey'
)

# Create 10 Nodes
for i in range(0,10):
    n = Node(name='Node '+str(i))
    g.add_node(n)

# Grab a list of all the Nodes.
ns = g.node_list()

# Create a default LinkType
lt = LinkType()
g.add_link_type(lt)

# Create 30 random Links.
for i in range(0,30):
    origin = randint(0, len(ns)-1)
    terminus = randint(0, len(ns)-1)
    while terminus == origin:
        terminus = randint(0, len(ns)-1)
    link = Link(ns[origin].uid, ns[terminus].uid, lt.name, value=randint(1, lt.max))
    g.add_link(link)
    
# Put 3 Details on each Node.
for node in ns:
    for i in range(0, 3):
        d = Detail("http://psymphonic.com", type='link')
        node.add_detail(d)
        
# Put 3 Details on each Link
for link in g.link_list():
    for i in range(0, 3):
        d = Detail("http://psymphonic.com", type='link')
        link.add_detail(d)
        
# Calculate the layout of the Graph
g.draw()
```

### Documentation
Check out the [docs](annotated.html)

### Authors and Contributors
This package is created and maintained by Psymphonic Inc.
